title: Determining Normality
question_text:
How could one determine if the distribution of sample means is approximately normal?
I. Both $np$ and $n (1-p)$ are greater than $10$, where $n$ is the number of trials and $p$ is the proportion of success.
II. The sample is large, say greater than $30$.
III. The parent population is approximately normal.
solution:
Statement I is incorrect; this condition involves sample proportions to be approximately normal, not sample means.

Statement II is correct; the central limit theorem ensures approximate normality if the sample is large enough.

Statement III is correct; if the parent population is normal, the sampling distribution will be approximately normal no matter the sample size.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'E'.
